content: In 10 years, society will be divided into two classes: an overclass leveraging AI for wealth and automated income, and an underclass managed by AI, a phenomenon economists refer to as the "K-shaped economy."
The next 2-3 years will determine an individual's position within the K-shaped economy.
Workers with AI skills earn 56% more than those without, and this premium doubled in a single year.
Industries adopting AI are experiencing three times the revenue growth per employee compared to others.
90% of workers have not undertaken any AI training.
Goldman Sachs estimates that 300 million jobs will be affected by AI by 2028.
To avoid being in the 'underclass' of the K-shaped economy, individuals should build systems with AI, automate workflows, and use AI to create value that makes them irreplaceable.
The gap between those who leverage AI and those who don't will widen significantly within six months, potentially becoming uncrossable within a year.

The K-shaped economic trajectory post-2025 integration is visualized as two diverging lines: 'High Agency + AI Mastery' curving sharply upward, and 'Low Agency + Managed by AI' curving downward, illustrating the split between adaptive, autonomous individuals leveraging AI and dependent individuals managed by it.
